Hi, I was just chatting with Mike Clark about my desire to save
historical =
test JUnit results, and to have a way to generate a graph
from them.  I'm i=
magining an ant target that would automatically build a
bar chart that show=
s the progress of test results over the course of a
project.  The X axis wo=
uld be time, maybe in 1 week increments.  The Y
axis would be number of tes=
ts.  And I'd have a stacked bar for each week
to show the total tests execu=
ted, broken down into pass/fail/error.
That way, management could look at t=
he chart and see our progress on the
project from the perspective of tests =
(whether it's unit tests or system
tests that use JUnit) and feel happy.  L=
ater I might even add in code
coverage percentages for even more juicy good=
ness.

Has anyone else put something like this together?  Mike mentioned he=
's
heard of others who want to build such a results graphing tool, but
didn=
't know if anyone's got one they're sharing.  So I'm posting here,
looking =
for pointers.


Thanks in advance,
Todd.
